Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [enters office, somersaults onto couch, kicks over painting and lamp] Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight & Andy
Quote.Text: [rush into office, Andy climbs on reception desk, Dwight holds video camera]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walking on Pam's desk, then Jim's desk] Extreme! Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This... is Parkour. [turns laptop to camera, shows Parkour instructional video] Internet sensation of 2004. And it was in one of the Bond films. It's pretty impressive. [Michael is shown climbing/walking on various objects in office] The goal is to get from point A to point B as creatively as possible, so technically they are doing Parkour, as long as point A is delusion and point B is the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [stands on his hands kicking open bathroom doors as Andy films, Meredith is seen applying deodorant in women's bathroom]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight & Andy
Quote.Text: [approaching elevator, as Michael films] Parkour! Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy! Leapfrog! [Andy leapfrogs Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do me! Do me!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah! [Dwight jumps on Andy's back, riding him like a horse] Parkour! Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ow! Get off! Get off!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Michael
Quote.Text: [walking across cars in parking lot, Dwight filming] Parkour! Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [crouching beside car] Jump over the camera! Jump over the camera! [Michael feebly attempts to jump off car, gives double thumbs up to camera]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [standing on tractor trailer with Dwight and Andy, looking down] Okay, we all go together or we go one at a time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here it is, here it is... truck, to refrigerators, to dumpster, [camera pans to refrigerator boxes, then dumpster] 360 onto the pallets, backflip gainer to the trash can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael & Dwight
Quote.Text: [in unison] Yeah! Gainer! Woohoo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Michael's camera] Hardcore Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Parkoooooour!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's do it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [leaps from trailer, disappears into empty refrigerator box]

Quote.Speaker: Michael & Dwight
Quote.Text: [look down, appearing shocked and concerned]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [inside refrigerator box, sounding injured] Parkour!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on telephone] Good. Excellent. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Female Intern
Quote.Text: [hands Dwight a cup of water] There you go. Is there anything else I can do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [chugs water, throws away cup] Yes. Umm... see those files behind Kevin's desk?

Quote.Speaker: Female Intern
Quote.Text: [nods] Mm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go put them all in random order.

Quote.Speaker: Female intern
Quote.Text: [confused] Mm-kay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then come back here for your next assignment concerning their order.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is the last day of our summer interns. It's been nice. We haven't had interns for a while, ever since Michael's Monica Lewinsky incident. [interns are shown gathered around Kelly's desk, one holding a box of tissues, as Kelly cries and wipes tears] He didn't do anything sexual. [female intern opens a jar of salsa for Michael] He just made far, far too many Monica Lewinsky jokes. [Meredith rubs her breasts into Maurie's back] It was just easier for corporate to shut down the program.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [to Oscar, motioning to male intern and female intern] Think she did him?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I bet there's something there. I was with them in the kitchen yesterday, and they were all too happy to be cleaning the freezer.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: If they get married before I do, I'm going to kill myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [entering break room] Who's getting married?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nobody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If somebody doesn't tell me, I'm gonna start screaming.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's Eric and Megan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Hey, I hired them! Matchmaker! This place is like Spaniard Fly.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: They're not getting married. It's just talk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did everybody know about this but me?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: There's nothing to know, it's just gossip.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [shaking head disgustedly] Okay... okay. [leaves room]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [talking head with Jim] We haven't told anyone I'm pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, with her being unmarried... knocked up by some guy, I mean the yakity-yaks in this office would have a field day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, we don't want them at the wedding thinking Jim's being marched down the aisle by my dad with a shotgum.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, there's not gonna be a shotgun?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No shotgun... 'cause that changes everything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can't back out now, Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you gonna do about it? There's no shotgun, so... free at last, free at last!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, keep it up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [approaches Dwight's desk] You'll never guess what I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [typing] Okay, let me finish this thought.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Eric likes Megan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [still typing] He most definitely does. He's been asking her out repeatedly for weeks. She finally said yes. They went out on a group date the other night; apparently it went very well.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [annoyed] How do you know this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [still typing] People tell me things. I guess I have a face you can trust. I think it's because of my low cheekbones. And... boom. [finishes typing, turns to face Michael] Okay, what is it, what can't I guess?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hate, hate, hate being left out. Whether it's not being picked for a team, or being picked for a team and showing up and realizing the team doesn't exist. Or that the sport doesn't exist? I should've known. Poopball?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Maurie, the Asian intern] Man, I know how you feel. Third wheel. I have been the third wheel so many times in my life. My mom told me something once that made me feel a lot better. She said "The third wheel is what makes it a tricycle."

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm talking about your group date with Megan and Eric.

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: At Tink's?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: How'd you know about that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: Did Stanley tell you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [confused] Stanley was on your group date?

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: No, Stanley was with his wife. I waved at him, but he didn't wave back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] Does anybody else know about this?

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs, looks to camera excitedly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There he goes. There he goes. [Stanley gets up from his desk, walks into kitchen area]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, what is the scuttlebutt? Anybody hear anything?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight, Jim & Pam
Quote.Text: [stare blankly at Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing? Well I got a little somethin' somethin'. I don't know if I should say...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just keep it to yourself then.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanly is having a midlife crisis.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley's way past the middle of his life. Especially considering his height to weight ratio.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well apparently, he and his wife were out dancing at a club for young people.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Teri's out of town, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Teri, Stanley's wife. She's at an interior decorating expo in Philly. Stanley hates crowds, kids, and music. I think you should check your facts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [starts to speak, says nothing, walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [entering break room, to Maurie] You stupid son of a bitch. You set me up.

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley's wife is out of town.

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: He was with somebody.

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: He was definitely with somebody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, was he? Well who, his sister?

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [upset] I don't get it!

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: If that was his sister, then what they were doing was totally illegal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Drugs?

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: Making out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [fumbling for words] Mmm... okay. Uhh... hmm... okay. Never mind. Carry on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [approaching Kelly's desk, whispering] Stanley is having an affir.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: WHAT??

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am very happy right now. Thrilled perhaps, to be part of the office, to be part of the conversation. When you have somebody's attenton, and their eyes are lighting up because they are very interested in what you have to say, [Michael is seen whispering to Jim, then Pam] that is a great feeling, and I experienced that firsthand today. It is wonderful to be the center of attention.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [motioning to pad of paper with hangman game, spelling out "S_an_ey is chea_in_ _n _eri] That and that are the same letter.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Q.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... no. He's holding a pencil. He could be doing a crossword puzzle with that pencil. What's that letter, right there? Same letter here and here. What haven't you guessed?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: T.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: T! Yes! Yes! That is a "T", and there's another one right there. Just sound that out. You're almost there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [opening blinds as Stanley walks past] Hey, Stanley! Where you goin', big guy? Up to no good?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm meeting a client. Do you have a problem with that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I just had a quick question for you. I'm casting a movie and I'm looking for a woman who can dance, beautiful woman. Do you know anybody?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Goodbye. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pays five million dollars. Nudity required.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [approaching Michael] You have to stop this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [giddy, whispering] Did you hear Stanley's having an affair?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I did. From you. You gotta stop telling people.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay, I get it. You feel out of the loop, and you feel sorry for yourself, and it's really sad because everybody thinks you're a loser...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you know if it's true? Do you have any idea? Because you might be ruining his life.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stares at Jim silently, then walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in parking lot, blocking path of Stanley's car] Stop. Hold up, hold up, hold up! No, no, no. Time to stop being polite and get real. [Stanley honks horn repeatedly] Stanley, are you having an affair?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [as Michael gets in car] That is ridiculous. Of course not, why would you think that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So It's not true. Okay, well... ahhh, those interns, they told me they saw you at a club, and they all said it was you, it was clearly just... racial profiling gossip.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [hits steering wheel angrily] Damn! I told her it was a stupid idea to go up in that club.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [nodding] So stupid!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's just that... Teri's been traveling a lot...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: And it's been lonely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I bet.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Cynthia's been keeping me company. She was my nurse, when I was in rehabilitation. We used to go on these long walks on the treadmill... I didn't...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, hold, hold, hold... so it IS true?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah, but Michael, I'm going to go break it off. That's where I'm headed right now. I swear.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God! Wait a second, do people often say they're going on sales calls and then go someplace else? 'Cause that's not cool.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I just need you to promise not to say a word about this to anyone. Michael, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [muttering] I'm not saying... a damn thing.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm counting on you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looking afraid] You can count on me.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [entering kitchen area] Oh, that smells good.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I might have extra, it just depends on how many I eat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you hear about Angela? That's pretty weird.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah... what do you mean exactly?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, the fact that she is apparently dating an 81-year-old billionaire. Owns a Quizno's on the turnpike.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Reeeeally.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh. [gestures to Kevin to keep it quiet] Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do you un-tell something? You can't. You can't put words back in your mouth. What you can do is spread false gossip so that people think that everything that's been said is untrue, including "Stanley is having an affair." It's like the end of Spartacus. I've seen that movie half a dozen times, and I still don't know who the real Spartacus is, and that is what makes that movie a classic whodunit.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Kelly has an eating disorder?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: She always eats my lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anorexia. She's an anorexatic.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We should do something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing can be done, we just have to tell everybody and hope for the best I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Kelly] I'm worried about Erin, because she's not a very good worker. I don't know how long she's gonna last here.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. So... and Andy is gay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard??

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispering to Meredith] Did you hear Pam is pregnant?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: She's gonna hate being a mom.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [making a cup of tea in kitchen area]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [looks at Andy and giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [still giggling] Tea.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You would.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [laughing] I like tea!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [sarcastically] Oh, I bet you like it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hahaha! I like it a lot! I love tea!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you like it as much as you like mens' butts?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: WHAT??

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Because you're gay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [serious] Who told you that? Was it Broccoli Rob? Someone from Chi Psi? Or did you run into someone from my high school?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is not the first time rumors about me being gay have come up. Twice before, actually. Just a weird coincidence... a little too weird. [chuckles nervously] Almost makes you wonder if it's not a coincidence at all. Whoa! Which it is, of course. [long pause] But it makes you wonder.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Oscar in break room] Did you hear the rumor about me? That I'm gay?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [nodding] I did. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you think it's true? Do you think that I'm... gay?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you attracted to other men?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [scoffs and chuckles] No! But, let me kick you a scenario. I'm at a beach cabana, and Brad Pitt approaches. He tries to lean in and kiss me. I would definitely resist, like at first. But if he was persistent, [long pause] I think I might give in a little bit, just to see what it... felt like.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [stares at Andy incredulously]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Would I push him away? How hard? Like, what if he's like really aggressive?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: If you resisted Brad Pitt a little bit, he would still... need to get to you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's not real Brad Pitt, this is like, this is my fantasy. Or it's like, not a fantasy, it's just... it's just a scenario.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wow. I wish... I wish I could help you. I don't... you might be gay. You might be gay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What exactly is my responsibility here? To comfort insecure heterosexual men? That can't possibly fall to me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: How far along is Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: A few months, that's why they're rushing the wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispering] Guys, guys... you can't believe everything you hear. Like Stanley, having an affair? That is crazy! It's just... there's no stalking it. It's a weird day for false facts. Let it go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [with everyone assembled in conference room] Okay everybody, big day. Last day for our interns, a lot of other stuff... who knows what to believe? Dwight, the honors.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [giving envelopes to interns] Present these to the dean for credit. And, as a gift, I've attached my card. Call me any time of the day or night.

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: Why would we call you at night?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grabs card from Eric, crumples it, throws it to the ground] Well now you can't call me at all. Problem solved.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Eric] You're gonna regret that when you find yourself between a moose and her cubs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look at the intern to your left. Now to your right. [interns do nothing] One of you will do exceedingly well in business, just unlimited potential. One of you will make a living, and nothing more. And one of you [looks directly at Megan] will make a great mother. It's up to you to choose which you want to be.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [eating cake with Kelly] I am so happy you're eating again.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [mouth full of cake] Me too!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Tuna, how come you never try to set me up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't really do that. But Pam might have some friends, though.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Women friends?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not guy friends?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you... interested in her guy friends?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. I mean, for the record, I prefer women.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But off the record, I'm kinda confused.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, the evidence is sort of stacked against me, I feel like...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well you gotta figure this out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You gotta have sex with a woman.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right-o.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And a man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ohh...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And then compare.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright. [looks around uneasily] Well hey...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Congratulations to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: On what?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Come on... little baby Tuna. Little junior toro.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks around room nervously]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Did you know a baby conceived out of wedlock is still a bastard?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Want me to say it again?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why did that come into your brain?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [grabs Pam by the arm] Can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispering to Pam in corner of room] So, they know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who did you tell?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't tell anyone! Who did you tell?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nobody!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [approaching Jim and Pam] Hey, did one of you tell Stanley I have asthma? Because I don't, and if it gets out, they won't let me scuba.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: If I can't scuba, then what's this all been about? What am I working toward?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [to Andy] What? You think I'm the voice of the Taco Bell dog?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [to Phyllis and Stanley] What are you guys talking about? I have a daughter. How can I be a virgin?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, has everyone heard a crazy rumor about themselves today?

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [in unison] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [entering conference room] Yeah, yeah... you know what? Let's discredit these rumors.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure, but... who's been saying all that stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not important, Jim, I just think we shouldn't listen to any of that crap.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure, but we should get to the bottom of this. Let's pick a rumor and trace it back to the beginning.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I need to do mine first. Who's been saying that there's another person inside of me, working me with controls?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I heard that from... Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I heard it from Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I heard it from Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [quietly leaves room]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [approaching Michael at elevators] Michael? [to others] He's over here!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Michael] Where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nowhere.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael... [leads Michael to corner of vestibule, then whispers] You told people I use store-bought manure, when I showed you where my manure comes from. Hmm? Hmm? [Michael looks nervously to camera as elevator doors open]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't get on it. [Michael inches toward elevator]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, don't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't... get... on. Do not.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Stay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Step away.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Come on, boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [reluctantly exits elevator]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to everyone, in conference room] Okay, I made it all up.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [sighs in unison]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Even the fact that I'm gay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [relieved] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But guys, I'm a victim here too, okay? People here have been saying that I'm a J. Crew model.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. We heard that about Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim? No, no. I spread the rumor that somebody here was a J. Crew model, and I was referring to myself.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How is that a bad rumor?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because a lot of people think that models, even though they're very attractive, are somewhat vapid. It's set our industry back quite a bit.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, why? Why say all these things? Why make up an eating disorder, Stanley's affair, me being a spokesdog...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [pissed off] You told everyone I was having an affair?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay... here's the thing. There was one true rumor out there today. I didn't want everybody to know what it was. So all of you are off the hook, except for this one person.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well then, what's the one true rumor?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We have a right to know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael... am I gay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] The one true rumor, and this is going to ruin this person's life, is that...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [interrupting] That Pam's pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I knew it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I knew it! Her breasts were a tiny bit bigger. At first I thought "Oh, she has a new bra with padding." But then I thought "Pam doesn't need padding." It just didn't add up, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Congratulations!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's really great, you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't vaccinate it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who's the father?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: How far along?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Four months.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Who's the OB/GYN?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop. Don't. Just...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, alright... you know, this is not the truth, and you can't fall on the sword this way. The real thing is that Stanley Hudson had an affair.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Jim...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [arm around Pam] Thank you for trying to defend her. But actually, Pam is pregnant, and we can prove it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If everyone would like to see proof.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. [leaves room]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Are we just gonna wait here? [Pam returns, displays sonogram]

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [gasps, then cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's true!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at that! [grabs sonogram from Pam] That is the inside of your vagina! [Jim takes sonogram from Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [talking head with Jim] It's clear why we were trying not to tell people. That's clear now. [Jim nods, looking at floor]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Jim and Pam] How long have you known about the pregnancy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim & Pam
Quote.Text: [look at each other uncertainly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A week? A month? A year?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, we only told our parents last week.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you pee on a stick?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I did. It was inconclusive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You should've told me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [exchanges looks with Jim] You're right. We should've realized that you are an equal part of this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [phone rings, hits speaker button]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael, Teri Hudson returning your call.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in disbelief] You called Stanley's wife?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, oh... yeah, a long time ago, just to make sure she was out of town. Oh... oh God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't take it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I have to take it, or it'll seem suspicious.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you talk to her, you're gonna tell her about Stanley, and that's gonna seem more suspicious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, I can do this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You can't do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I can. I am going to tell her that I need to redecorate my condo, and I need her help. We will haggle about money, and then I will back down, and then I won't talk to her until this whole Cynthia thing has blown over.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That sounds terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, please don't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [picking up phone] Hey, what up, Cynthia? [lowers phone, looking terrified]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [gets up to leave room, Michael gestures for him to stay]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hold on a second, Cynthia.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hangs up Michael's phone, leaves room]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it turns out that Teri was already suspicious, because she had caught Stanley and Cynthia a few months ago. So Stanley promised that he would stop, and he did, end of story. Well, not exactly. [camera pans down from Michael's office window to parking lot below, Stanley is seen destroying Michael's Sebring with a crowbar] Uhh, Cynthia kept calling him, she would not stop calling him, and she was in love with him. Oh, and get this. Cynthia, also married. So... you can't stop love, I guess [Jim is seen displaying fetus picture on his desk as Pam smiles] and quite frankly, I don't think you should ever try.

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: [talking head with Eric and Megan] I learned that a company can describe their internship as "full of exciting experiences," even if that's a lie. There's no regulation.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: I learned that half these people's email password is "password."

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: I learned that a ream of paper is 300 sheets.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: I thought it was 500.

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: Oh... I guess I didn't learn anything.

Quote.Speaker: Maurie
Quote.Text: I learned that if you look even the tiniest bit like Jet Li, Michael will call you "Jet Li" all summer.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Julia Stiles.

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Alan Thicke.
